#Text=7 .
#Text=Conclusions
#Text=This paper took IPTP as the research object and used CHFS data to analyze the impact of IPTP on income inequality and social poverty .
#Text=Statistical analysis shows that the proportion of private transfer income in the total household income of rural families is lower than that of urban families .
#Text=Family income inequality analysis showed that the income inequality of rural households is more serious than that of urban areas .
#Text=Because the living standards and consumption levels in urban areas are far higher than those in rural areas , only when household income reaches a certain level can they live in cities .

#Text=That is to say , there is a threshold of household income , which is the floor level to meet the basic life needs in cities , and the urban household incomes are mostly above the threshold value .
#Text=Moreover , the middle-income group in urban areas accounts for the vast majority .
#Text=However , in rural areas , the income of poor families is very low , and the income of rich families may be very high , resulting in greater inequality than in urban areas .
#Text=If IPTP is exogenous , it can reduce the inequality of both rural families and urban families , and the improvement in rural areas is greater than that of urban areas .
#Text=This is because in rural areas , the lower family income , the more motivation to work in cities , so as to increase the income of poor families .
#Text=Considering the possible endogeneity of IPTP , counterfactual analysis shows that IPTP increases family income inequality .
#Text=From the perspective of the human network , every family has its own private transfer payment network .
#Text=Private transfer payment has a strong correlation with the family income level in the network .
#Text=According to the hierarchical distribution of family income levels , the hierarchical distribution of private transfer payment can be obtained .

#Text=Private transfer payments can create more wealth in high-income family networks , while in low-income family networks , private transfer payments are also at a low level , which plays a very limited role .
#Text=One result of this is that the rich get richer , while the poor are still at a low-income level , thus widening the gap between the rich and the poor and aggravating inequality .

#Text=From the analysis of income , consumption , and household poverty , we found that the IPTP not only directly subsidizes the total household income but also indirectly promotes the increase of household income .
#Text=At the same time , IPTPs also stimulate household consumption and increase household consumption expenditure .
#Text=Although IPTPs increases household income and consumption expenditure , they have no significant impact on the poverty level of Chinese households .
#Text=On the whole , the objective existence of IPTPs still have a positive significance .
#Text=Firstly , IPTPs improve people ’s living standards from two aspects : Increasing the total family income and rising household consumption expenditure .
#Text=Secondly , although the IPTP may deepen the inequality of household income , it makes the rich richer by promoting the income growth of high-income families , thus widening the income gap .
#Text=For low-income families , although there is no significant improvement , it does not make the poor poorer .
#Text=Based on the findings of this study , we can draw the following policy implications about improving income inequality and reducing social poverty .
#Text=First , people should try their best to maintain the " exogeneity " of IPTP and reduce its substitution for household income .
#Text=The study finds that if the IPTP is exogenous , it can reduce the income inequality of both urban and rural households .
#Text=Therefore , urban and rural residents should be encouraged not to reduce their production and work time even if they have IPTP , so that IPTP is independent of family income expectations .
#Text=Second , be good at making use of IPTP to invest or reproduce .
#Text=At present , IPTPs have not significantly alleviated the poverty levels of families .
#Text=The main reason is that for most families , the IPTP has directly transformed into household consumption expenditure and has not played a greater role .
#Text=Third , the government should encourage urban and rural residents to strive to develop stable sources of income and become rich through hard work .
#Text=IPTP is often an “ unexpected gift . ”
#Text=To get rid of poverty and become rich , people should rely on their own efforts to increase family income , instead of expecting other people ’s private gifts .
#Text=Just as Chinese President Xi Jinping said , “ Happiness comes from struggle . ”
#Text=In future research , we can focus on more details , such as who remits , and how much , if the data permits it .
#Text=Remittances are always related to migration closely .
#Text=In this paper , we did not differentiate the remittances according to their sources .
#Text=We can also research remittances together with population migration in a further study .
#Text=Different migration routes lead to different remittances styles .
#Text=We could also conduct research on how different styles of migration and remittances affect income distribution and poverty .
